revised_title: Susceptibility of Animals to the Naturally Infected Dog Strain of Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland
tldr: The study investigates the susceptibility of various animals to the naturally infected dog strain of trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland. The results show that cattle, goats, sheep, antelope, monkeys, rabbits, guinea pigs, and dogs were susceptible to the disease, with varying degrees of severity and duration.
